info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:24PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN THOMAS...NORTHERN SHERIDAN AND SOUTHWESTERN DECATUR COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM CDT... At 324 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rexford, or 18 miles northwest of Hoxie, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Thomas, northern Sheridan and southwestern Decatur Counties, including the following locations... Leoville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
